 Solve the mixed mode asymptotic relation between p modes and g modes using l=0 frequencies as input.
 

Detailed Description

Contains functions for solving the asymptotic relation of the mixed modes.

This file contains functions that are adapted from the solver_mm.py function. These functions are used to solve the asymptotic relation of the mixed modes. The development of these functions was based on reading papers by Benoit Mosser and Charlotte Gehand.

Papers referenced:

  • Mosser, B., et al. "Mixed modes in red giants: a window on stellar evolution." Astronomy & Astrophysics 540 (2012): A143.
  • Mosser, B., et al. "Scaling relations for the width of the red-giant branch in the Kepler field." Astronomy & Astrophysics 517 (2010): A22.
  • Mosser, B., et al. "The universal red-giant oscillation pattern - An automated determination with CoRoT data." Astronomy & Astrophysics 525 (2011): L9.
  • Mosser, B., et al. "Mixed modes in red giants: a window on stellar evolution." Astronomy & Astrophysics 572 (2014): L5.
  • Gehan, C. "Étude des modes mixtes dans les étoiles géantes rouges." PhD thesis, Université de Toulouse (2019).

Note that the examples and tests functions in this file were built using asymptotic relations in the original Python code. However, these functions should be applicable to any set of values for nu_p(nu), nu_g(nu), Dnu_p(nu), and DPl(nu) (meaning handling glitches).

Compute the asymptotic relation for the g modes.

Parameters

Returns

lThe value of l.
delta0lThe value of delta0l.

nmaxThe value of nmax.
rThe extra term to add to Dnu_p (default is 0).
Returns
The resulting value of nu_p.

◆ sign_change()

VectorXi sign_change ( const VectorXd &  x,
bool  return_indices = true 
)

Function that detects sign changes in a given vector. If the sign went from + to -, tag it with a -1. If the sign went from - to +, tag it with a +1. If there is no change of sign, tag it with a 0. 0 is dealt as a zone of change of sign as well. eg. if we pass from 0 to 2, then the result is +1.

Parameters
xThe input vector for which we want to know sign changes.
return_indicesIf true (default), the function returns positions at which the sign changed. If false, it returns a vector of tags for the sign changes.
Returns
The vector of sign changes or the positions at which the sign changed.

◆ solve_mm_asymptotic_O2from_l0()

Data_eigensols solve_mm_asymptotic_O2from_l0 ( const VectorXd &  nu_l0_in,
const int  el,
const long double  delta0l,
const long double  DPl,
const long double  alpha,
const long double  q,
const long double  sigma_p,
const long double  resol,
bool  returns_pg_freqs = true,
bool  verbose = false,
const long double  freq_min = 0,
const long double  freq_max = 1e6 
)

Solve the mixed mode asymptotic relation between p modes and g modes using l=0 frequencies as input.

Parameters
nu_l0_inFrequencies for the l=0 modes. Used to derive nu_l1_p and therefore Dnu and epsilon.
elDegree of the mode.
delta0lFirst order shift related to core structure (and to D0).
DPlAverage Period spacing of the g modes.
alphaPhase offset for the g modes.
qCoupling strength.
sigma_pStandard deviation controlling the randomization of individual p modes. Set it to 0 for no spread.
resolControl the grid resolution. Might be set to the resolution of the spectrum.
returns_pg_freqsIf true, returns the values for calculated p and g modes.
verboseIf true, print the solution on screen.
freq_minThe minimum frequency considered for the solution (in microHz).
freq_maxThe maximum frequency considered for the solution (in microHz).
Returns
A structure with the solutions that match p(nu) = g(nu).

◆ solve_mm_asymptotic_O2from_nupl()

Data_eigensols solve_mm_asymptotic_O2from_nupl ( const VectorXd &  nu_p_all,
const int  el,
const long double  DPl,
const long double  alpha,
const long double  q,
const long double  sigma_p,
const long double  resol,
bool  returns_pg_freqs = true,
bool  verbose = false,
const long double  freq_min = 0,
const long double  freq_max = 1e6 
)

Solve the mixed mode asymptotic relation between p modes and g modes using l=0 frequencies as input.

Parameters
nu_p_allFrequencies for the l modes.
elDegree of the mode.
DPlAverage Period spacing of the g modes.
alphaPhase offset for the g modes.
qCoupling strength.
sigma_pStandard deviation controlling the randomization of individual p modes. Set it to 0 for no spread.
resolControl the grid resolution. Might be set to the resolution of the spectrum.
returns_pg_freqsIf true, returns the values for calculated p and g modes.
verboseIf true, print the solution on screen.
freq_minThe minimum frequency considered for the solution (in microHz).
freq_maxThe maximum frequency considered for the solution (in microHz).
Returns
A structure with the solutions that match p(nu) = g(nu).

◆ solve_mm_asymptotic_O2p()

Data_eigensols solve_mm_asymptotic_O2p ( const long double  Dnu_p,
const long double  epsilon,
const int  el,
const long double  delta0l,
const long double  alpha_p,
const long double  nmax,
const long double  DPl,
const long double  alpha,
const long double  q,
const long double  sigma_p,
const long double  fmin,
const long double  fmax,
const long double  resol,
bool  returns_pg_freqs = true,
bool  verbose = false 
)

Solve the mixed mode asymptotic relation between p modes and g modes.

Parameters
Dnu_pThe large separation for p modes (in microHz).
epsilonThe value of epsilon.
elThe value of el.
delta0lThe value of delta0l.
alpha_pThe value of alpha_p.
nmaxThe value of nmax.
DPlThe period spacing for g modes (in seconds).
alphaThe value of alpha.
qThe coupling term (no unit, should be between 0 and 1).
sigma_pThe value of sigma_p.
fminThe minimum frequency considered for the solution (in microHz).
fmaxThe maximum frequency considered for the solution (in microHz).
resolThe base resolution for the interpolated base function.
returns_pg_freqsIf true, returns nu_m, nu_p, nu_g, dnup, and dPg.
verboseIf true, print additional information.
Returns
A structure with the solutions that match p(nu) = g(nu).

◆ solver_mm()

Data_coresolver solver_mm ( const long double  nu_p,
const long double  nu_g,
const long double  Dnu_p,
const long double  DPl,
const long double  q,
const long double  numin,
const long double  numax,
const long double  resol,
const bool  returns_axis = false,
const bool  verbose = false,
const long double  factor = 0.05 
)

Solve the mixed mode asymptotic relation between p modes and g modes.

Parameters
nu_pThe frequency of a given p-mode (in microHz).
nu_gThe frequency of a given g-mode (in microHz).
Dnu_pThe large separation for p modes (in microHz).
DPlThe period spacing for g modes (in seconds).
qThe coupling term (no unit, should be between 0 and 1).
numinThe minimum frequency considered for the solution (in microHz).
numaxThe maximum frequency considered for the solution (in microHz).
resolThe base resolution for the interpolated base function.
returns_axisIf true, returns nu, pnu, and gnu.
verboseIf true, print additional information.
factorDefine how fine the new tiny grid used for performing the interpolation will be.
Returns
A structure with the solutions that match p(nu) = g(nu).
